DataElement.preferredName: Biospecimen Events Domain Other Action Taken Sponsor Defined Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Terminology assigned by the sponsor to the codelist associated with the other activity for biospecimen collection and/or storage.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Biospecimen Events Domain Other Action Taken
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An events domain that documents biospecimen collection and storage information._A description that an activity, other than one prespecified or previously characterized, has occurred.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An events domain that documents biospecimen collection and storage information.

Concepts.definition: An events domain that documents biospecimen collection and storage information.

Property.preferredDefinition: A description that an activity, other than one prespecified or previously characterized, has occurred.

Concepts.definition: A description that an activity, other than one prespecified or previously characterized, has occurred.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Other Action Taken Clinical Study Sponsor Defined Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A description that an activity, other than one prespecified or previously characterized, has occurred._An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]_Clearly characterized or delimited._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

A request for a new sample.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication that the data can be evaluated and that the quality control metrics were good.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication that the existing data cannot be evaluated.: Make or do or perform again.

Make or do or perform again.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication that the data can be evaluated even though the quality control metrics were not good.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Other Action Taken Clinical Study Sponsor Defined Type
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A description that an activity, other than one prespecified or previously characterized, has occurred.:An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]:Clearly characterized or delimited.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: A description that an activity, other than one prespecified or previously characterized, has occurred.

An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
